text: Bill Gates dropped out of Harvard in 1975 to start Microsoft with Paul Allen. They wrote the first BASIC interpreter for the Altair 8800. Microsoft's big break came in 1980 when IBM chose MS-DOS as their PC operating system. Gates bought the rights to QDOS for fifty thousand dollars and licensed it to IBM, keeping the rights to sell to other manufacturers. This decision made Microsoft the dominant software company of the PC era.
